title: Gilded equipment

properties.name: description
properties.value: Gilded equipment pieces are potential rewards from hard, elite and master tier Treasure Trails. It is essentially gold-plated rune equipment, as stat bonuses between any gilded piece and its regular counterpart are identical. Gilded items are mostly worn as status symbols of wealth, due to their high prices with no advantage in combat over the regular rune armour set.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Gilded armour
A female player wearing a gilded plateskirt.

Gilded equipment pieces are potential rewards from hard, elite and master tier Treasure Trails. It is essentially gold-plated rune equipment, as stat bonuses between any gilded piece and its regular counterpart are identical. Gilded items are mostly worn as status symbols of wealth, due to their high prices with no advantage in combat over the regular rune armour set.

Armour[edit | edit source]

Gilded armour can be obtained as very rare rewards by completing hard, elite and master tier Treasure Trails. Gilded boots, as well as gilded dragonhide armour, can only be looted from elite and master Treasure Trails.

All pieces require level 40 Defence to equip, and the gilded platebody requires the additional completion of the Dragon Slayer I. All pieces are statistically equivalent to their rune equipment counterparts.

Weapons[edit | edit source]

A player wielding a gilded scimitar.

Gilded weapons can be obtained as very rare rewards by completing hard, elite and master Treasure Trails. However, the gilded spade, scimitar, axe and pickaxe are only available from elite and master Treasure Trails.

All require level 40 Attack to equip and are statistically equivalent to their rune equipment counterparts.
